DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information regarding the position, site, or point where a systematic withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity was placed beneath the skin during a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means._Named location within the body where the device used for the withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity was placed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information regarding the position, site, or point where a systematic withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity was placed beneath the skin during a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Beneath the skin.:The systematic withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: The systematic withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to GOG for REBOYJ by script Thu Aug 1 14:45:44 EDT 2013

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Named location within the body where the device used for the withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity was placed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A medial line, especially the medial line or medial plane of the body (or some part of the body).: (in-SIH-zhun) A cut made in the body to perform surgery.

Concepts.definition: A medial line, especially the medial line or medial plane of the body (or some part of the body).
An intentional cut made to an individual's body with the intent of performing a diagnostic or therapeutic intervention.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: The external junctural region between the lower part of the abdomen and the thigh.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The lower region of the anterior abdominal wall located laterally to the pubic region.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: The external junctural region between the lower part of the abdomen and the thigh.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
The lower region of the anterior abdominal wall located laterally to the pubic region.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Beneath the skin.:The systematic withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity.:Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: The systematic withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity.
Named locations of or within the body.
